clinical_study.brief_title: Smart-TV Application for the Self Examination of the Distance Visual Acuity in Macular Edema Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of a Smart-tv Application for the Self Examination of the Distance Visual Acuity in Macular Edema Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Primary objective of our study is the development and validation of an application for smart-TVs for the self-examination of the distant visual acuity of patients diagnosed with macular edema.

detailed_description.textblock: Present study aims to develop and validate an application installed in Smart-TVs. This application will be referred to patients suffering from macular edema, allowing the self-examination of the patient in terms of distant visual acuity. The development of a simple but reliable way of self-examination of distant visual acuity would bring beneficial results in the overall management of these patients as significantly would reduce the flows to the outpatient ophthalmology clinics of the NSS Hospitals, would serve the purposes of the social distancing imposed by the current state of the pandemic but also any analogous situation and would help the patient to be vigilant and actively involved in the management of his disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance visual acuity test via ETDRS chart
primary_outcome.description: The distance visual acuity of each participant will be evaluated by the same examiner

primary_outcome.measure: Distance visual acuity self assessment via DDiVAT
primary_outcome.description: Participants will self examine his/her distance visual acuity via application in a simulation room of our department with certain predetermined environmental lighting conditions using the same smart devices.

arm_group.description: 100 patients with diagnosed macular edema will be enrolled

intervention.description: Participants will self examine his/her distance visual acuity via application in a simulation room of our department with certain predetermined environmental lighting conditions using the same smart devices.

intervention.intervention_name: Distance visual acuity assessment via ETDRS chart
intervention.description: The distance visual acuity of each participant will be measured with the conventional method via ETDRS chart

study_pop.textblock: Normal- and low-sighted participants aged 40 to 85 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age-dependent macular degeneration
- diabetic macular edema
Exclusion Criteria:
- corneal diseases
- glaucoma
- psychiatric disorders
- inability to cooperate

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor (Associate) of Democritus University of Thrace
